name: Gibson House Museum - My Voice in a Quilt
description:
This collective exhibition of textile artwork was handcrafted by Syrian women, all newcomers to Toronto, as part of a Toronto Arts Council Animating Historic Sites program.

Each quilt is composed of individual squares handcrafted by one woman, reflecting her emotions, memories, hopes and personal stories.

Together, these women gathered in a space for storytelling and emotional expression to share, support one another, and transform their lived experiences into art.

Together, these pieces create a shared tapestry of connection, strength and beauty through stitches, colours, and fabrics. Stories of loss and resilience, displacement and belonging, pain and hope are a shared narrative and experience.

Together, these quilts form a shared tapestry, a collective voice rising from women's hearts, creating beauty and solidarity through the art of textile making.

name: Leslieville Farmers' Market
description:
This indoor market season is packed with your favourite vendors and some exciting new ones too! 

We have all your favourite categories, from farmers bringing fresh greens, roots, fruit, and Ontario garlic straight from the fields. To
bakers and delicious hot meals ready to enjoy while you shop. 
Don't forget, small-batch soaps, skincare, and aromatherapy products
and pantry staples like: maple syrup, honey, preserves, and so much more!

It's a place to connect, eat, and celebrate the incredible community around us.
